thread.title: This Entire City Is Made Out Of Ice And It Will Blow Your Mind
thread.title_full: This Entire City Is Made Out Of Ice And It Will Blow Your Mind

author: Daniela Cadena
title: This Entire City Is Made Out Of Ice And It Will Blow Your Mind
text:
View this image › 
Cancan Chu / Getty Images ID: 10293355 3. Heads up: ALL OF THIS IS MADE OF ICE. View this image › 
Cancan Chu / Getty Images ID: 10293412 ID: 10293955 5. The festival started in 1985, and is held annually in the city of Harbin, located in one of China’s coldest regions. View this image › 
Fred Dufour / AFP / Getty Images The city’s location in northeast China is the perfect setting due to its arctic weather, which provides tons of natural ice and snow to preserve the sculptures.
ID: 10293552 6. Again, all of this is ICCCC . View this image › 
Nicolas Asfouri / AFP / Getty Images ID: 10293572 ID: 10293814 8. Even though the city is in a cold region, finding ice to carve isn’t always easy. View this image › 
Fred Dufour / AFP / Getty Images ID: 10293591 9. Man-made ice isn’t great for carving, so, according to China Daily, the ice used for the festival is sourced from the Songhua River which runs through the city. For weeks prior to the festival, more than 50 workers have to go down the river to collect enough ice for the sculptors to work with. View this image › 
Nicolas Asfouri / AFP / Getty Images And some double as rides.
ID: 10293756 ID: 10293762 11. Just like cool light-up sneakers, some of the ice sculptures are illuminated by colored LED lights. View this image › 
Nicolas Asfouri / AFP / Getty Images ID: 10293657 12. Ah-mazing. View this image › 
Cancan Chu / Getty Images ID: 10293361 ID: 10293791 14. The festival officially opened January 5th and it usually runs until late February. View this image › 
Fred Dufour / AFP / Getty Images ID: 10293575 View this image › 
Nicolas Asfouri / AFP / Getty Images ID: 10293593 16. *Buys selfie stick and books flight to China.* View this image › 
Disney ID: 10293974 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
